cluster_classes.class_description: Conceptual components that contribute to the formation of urban legends, including references to real people and the imaginative capacity used to create such stories.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Stories may be based on real events or historical figures; many are the product of collective imagination and creativity.

members.entity_description: Notable people from history who may be referenced in certain stories.
Human capacity to invent and elaborate imaginative stories like urban legends.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts concerned with analyzing urban legends as a narrative and cultural phenomenon, including their origins, authenticity, and how they vary over time or across regions.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: origins, authenticity, and variations of urban legends as a narrative tradition

members.entity_description: Different versions, adaptations, or altered forms of a core urban legend story that emerge over time or across regions.
The sources, beginnings, and historical development of urban legends, including how specific legends first arose and evolved as a narrative tradition.
The degree to which urban legends are genuine or fact-based.

cluster_classes.class_description: Conceptual and textual elements within a discussion about urban legends, including the essay itself and its focus on societal impact.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: “In this essay, we will explore the origins of urban legends, their impact on society…”

members.entity_name: impact of urban legends on society
members.entity_description: Influence that urban legends exert on social attitudes, behaviors, and cultural norms.
The specific written work that will explore origins, impact, and endurance of urban legends.

remarks: This class now intentionally represents the concrete essay/document only; analytic concepts previously mixed into this class have been moved to the analytic class.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts and processes specifically concerned with urban legends as a form of modern folklore, including their nature and how they spread and proliferate in society.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Urban legends as modern folklore and their spread and proliferation across regions and media.

members.entity_description: A category of modern folklore stories, such as the Hook Man, that circulate widely within communities through oral and digital transmission.
Dissemination of urban legends across regions and continents.
The widespread increase and spread of urban legends in society and media.

args.justification: The entity 'impact of urban legends on society' is an analytical concept and aligns directly with other analytical members (origins, authenticity, variations) in 'Urban Legend Studies', while the remaining member in its original class is a specific document.

args.new_description: Concepts concerned with the scholarly and analytical study of urban legends as a narrative and cultural phenomenon, including their origins, authenticity, variations, and social impact.
args.justification: Renaming and slightly broadening the description incorporates the newly reassigned 'impact' concept and better reflects the class as the hub for analytic/scholarly aspects of urban legends, while setting an appropriate shared Class_Group.

args.new_description: The specific written essay that explores the origins, impact, and endurance of urban legends, treated as a document-level information artifact.
args.remark: This class now intentionally represents the concrete essay/document only; analytic concepts previously mixed into this class have been moved to the analytic class.
args.justification: After moving the analytic 'impact' concept out, this class is best scoped to the remaining member 'this essay', so renaming, retargeting the type_hint to Document, and assigning the shared Class_Group clarifies its role.
This class covers urban legends as modern folklore and their spread; it should share a Class_Group with related analytic, compositional, and documentary classes in the same domain.
This class captures elements involved in creating urban legends (historical figures, creativity), clearly within the same urban-legend folklore domain, so it should share the common Class_Group.
Explicitly aligns the analytic/研究 class with the shared Class_Group connecting all urban-legend-related conceptual and documentary classes.

executed_decisions.justification: The entity 'impact of urban legends on society' is an analytical concept and aligns directly with other analytical members (origins, authenticity, variations) in 'Urban Legend Studies', while the remaining member in its original class is a specific document.
